content: **2 patterns in one ** this warm winter scarf is an easy pattern to crochet for the men in your family it also includes options for both cowl and infinity scarves *this crochet pattern is available for free on my website or you can download it here as a print-optimized ad-free pdf for your convenience * **difficulty ** easy **materials needed ** 5 5mm i hook or hook needed to obtain gauge 3 75mm f hook for edging 400-500 yards caron one pound in cape cod blue light grey medium grey mix or color of your choice yarn needle scissors **stitches used ** chain = chain slip_stitch = slip_stitch single_crochet = single_crochet half_double_crochet = half_double_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet fpsc = front post single_crochet bpsc = back post single_crochet rsc = reverse single_crochet crab stitch **additional terms ** working in the 3rd loop of half_double_crochet instructions look at the top of the stitch and locate the sideways v bend the stitch to look at the back and you should see another v made by the yarn over you ll be working into the back loop of that v this is called the 3rd loop rs = right side ws = wrong side st/sts = stitch/stitches **gauge ** 12 half_double_crochet in 4 or 36 half_double_crochet sts in 12 **measurements ** 6 wide by 5 6 or 7 long **additional notes ** -chain 1 at beginning of row/round does not count as a stitch -ribbed texture is only visible on the front side when you are asked to cut your yarn and reattach it to the other end make sure the front side of the scarf is facing you yes there will be several ends to weave in when you finish crocheting the scarf
